result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurie Lynn Salak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laurie Lynn Salak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laurie Lynn Salak was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 20, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports.
Court notes 1 day credit if revoked.


  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF77.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF77.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Mental Health Assessment is up to the discretion of the Agent.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurie Lynn Salak

records.addlTxt: E: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Laurie Lynn Salak appeared. Case called at 8:42 a.m. Court reviews file. ADA McKinley states Atty Hahn extended an offer in May. Gives recommendations. Atty Caton filed a plea questionnaire and is in agreement with the recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct. 1 without the repeater modifier. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Poss of Meth. without repeater modifier in 15CF77. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF77. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- S/W 2 years probation. Report by no later than 3 p.m. today. Bond will continue until defendant reports. 1 day jail credit

- Court costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid during the course of probation

- DNA Sample

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- Mental health assessment is up to the discretion of the probation agent

- Follow all rules and recommendations of the probation agent

- Eligible for substance abuse program but not the challenge incarcertation program
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Amber Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Laurie Lynn Salak appeared. Case called at 2:34 p.m. Atty Caton has received an offer from the state. Defendant requested a copy of the discovery. Requesting a date out 30 days. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Hahn. km
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

CO: Heckmann, REP: Electronic Recorder, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Laurie Lynn Salak appeared. Case called at 1:50 p.m. Atty Caton has copy of information. Waives reading. Court informs Def if charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Caton waives speedy trial, enters NG on all 3 counts. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
filed by ADA Alexis McKinley. gme
